course_title: Manual Therapy of the Spine and Extremities
course_description: This course focuses on manual therapy for musculoskeletal disorders in the adult orthopedic population.We will review the history of manual therapy, scope of practice and current use by physical therapists.Students will examine the risks and complications related to joint mobilization/manipulation in the context of patient safety.  Instructors will present research to support the efficacy and effectiveness of manual therapy.The course will define and explore different types of manual therapy, including soft tissue mobilization, joint mobilization/manipulation and nerve mobilization. Instructors will demonstrate and students will practice spinal, upper and lower quarter manual techniques.Students will learn appropriate home program selection in relation to manual techniques presented.Throughout the course, students will study case presentations to promote an understanding of regional interdependence and to enhance clinical reasoning skills.
